Comment: Right now there is a generic 145% tariff on China, and Trump has threatened to make a specific 145% tariff on Mattel's toys, regardless of where they come from.  Though there were specific toy tariffs in the past, those tariffs have been over-ridden by Trump's tariffs.    Like all things Trump, we never know if this is just talk or something that will happen in the future.  As of this post, there is no special Mattel Tariff and we'll see if such a tariff ever materializes.

Comment: There's a famous case [where Marvel tried to (and suceeded) in getting Mutants ruled as non-human in order to avoid tariffs](https://www.cbr.com/comic-book-urban-legends-revealed-152/).  Usually, Tariffs are complicated with specific definitions like you mentioned.  Trump has over-ruled those tariffs with his overly simplistic tariffs.  IMO, this is part of the reason why Trump is having so much difficulty making deals, Trade and tariffs are usually very complicated and very specific, Trump lacks the knowledge and ability to be so specific regarding trading deals and doesn't want to spend the day arguing or discussing small but important details.  But, since he's the president, and the dealmaker who makes the best deals, he's refusing to delegate those details to others, resulting in simplistic tariffs.
